alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 1:44PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected along the North Fork of the Powder River above Mayoworth. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Johnson. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding along the North Fork of the Powder River above Mayoworth. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mayoworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
